alert.note: Alert for Culebra; Northeast; San Juan and Vicinity (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued March 07 at 9:51PM AST until March 11 at 5:00PM AST by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Life-threatening rip currents expected due to breaking waves of at 6-9 feet. * WHERE...The beaches of San Juan and Vicinity, Northeast PR, Culebra and St Thomas/St John. * WHEN...Wednesday evening through Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper waters. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The danger will further increase during the week as additional swell activity results in higher breaking waves.
info.instruction: There is a high risk of rip currents. Rip currents are powerful channels of water flowing quickly away from shore, which occur most often at low spots or breaks in the sandbar and in the vicinity of structures such as groins, jetties and piers. Heed the advice of lifeguards, beach patrol flags and signs. If you become caught in a rip current, yell for help. Remain calm, do not exhaust yourself and stay afloat while waiting for help. If you have to swim out of a rip current, swim parallel to shore and back toward the beach when possible. Do not attempt to swim directly against a rip current as you will tire quickly.

area.areaDesc: Culebra; Northeast; San Juan and Vicinity
